image.altText: Side profile of James Hayward.

items.synopsis: A former WA MP is sentenced to almost three years in jail for sexually abusing a young girl, the same year he sought election to the state's upper house.

title.children: 'Catastrophic' fall: Former WA MP James Hayward jailed for child sex offences

image.altText: Firefighters putting out a bushfire

items.synopsis: Live and homes near the tourist WA town of Yallingup are under threat as a serious bushfire burns in the area.

title.children: Emergency warning issued for bushfire burning near Yallingup near WA's south-west coast

image.altText: A group of Middle Eastern people stand in a car park next to a gated tin shed on sunny day

items.synopsis: The Rafah border crossing between Egypt and Gaza will be reopened to allow foreign nationals out of the embattled Palestinian city, according to the US Secretary of State. Follow live.

title.children: Egypt-Gaza border to reopen, Australians 'strongly encouraged' to move quickly

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Reporting by Nour Haydar Australians in Gaza are being “strongly encouraged” to move quickly to the Rafah border crossing. Nineteen Australian citizens are known to be in Gaza. The Department Foreign Affairs and Trade has sent a message to Australians in the area to move to the crossing in southern Gaza if they “assess it to be safe”, citing media reports that the crossing will be open to Australian citizens. DFAT also says it will provide Australians with further details and support once they have reached Egypt.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Australians in Gaza being urged to move to Rafah border

children.content: Australians in Gaza are being “strongly encouraged” to move quickly to the Rafah border crossing.
Nineteen Australian citizens are known to be in Gaza.

The Department Foreign Affairs and Trade has sent a message to Australians in the area to move to the crossing in southern Gaza if they “assess it to be safe”, citing media reports that the crossing will be open to Australian citizens.
DFAT also says it will provide Australians with further details and support once they have reached Egypt.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The death toll in Gaza has risen to at least 2,750 people, according to Gaza's health ministry. About 9,700 people have also been wounded since October 7.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Gaza's death toll rises to 2,750

children.content: The death toll in Gaza has risen to at least
About 9,700 people have also been wounded since October 7.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The UNRWA Commissioner-General Philippe Lazzarini has given a dire update on the organisation's ability to continue in Gaza, saying it is "no longer able to provide humanitarian assistance." "Gaza is being strangled and it seems that the world right now has lost its humanity," he said from UNRWA headquarters in East Jerusalem. "If we look at the issue of water — we all know water is life — Gaza is running out of water, and Gaza is running out of life. "Soon, I believe, with this there will be no food or medicine either." He said the UNRWA team had relocated to the Rafah border to try and sustain aid. "The UNRWA operations is the largest United Nations footprint in the Gaza Strip, and we are on the verge of collapse," Mr Lazzarini said. "This is absolutely unprecedented." He called for a humanitarian corridor to be opened alongside a "suspension of hostilities for humanitarian reasons."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: UNRWA Commissioner-General says it can "no longer" provide aid in  Gaza

children.content: The UNRWA Commissioner-General Philippe Lazzarini has given a dire update on the organisation's ability to continue in Gaza, saying it is "no longer able to provide humanitarian assistance."
"Gaza is being strangled and it seems that the world right now has lost its humanity," he said from UNRWA headquarters in East Jerusalem.
"If we look at the issue of water — we all know water is life — Gaza is running out of water, and Gaza is running out of life.
"Soon, I believe, with this there will be no food or medicine either."
He said the UNRWA team had relocated to the Rafah border to try and sustain aid.
"The UNRWA operations is the largest United Nations footprint in the Gaza Strip, and we are on the verge of collapse," Mr Lazzarini said.
He called for a humanitarian corridor to be opened alongside a "suspension of hostilities for humanitarian reasons."

image.altText: A man, whose faces is obsucred, walks around a concrete area surrounded by high metal fenced walls.
